headlines: Tech-driven risk rally continues as S&P 500 approaches record highs, Nasdaq outperforms
Trump-Xi summit reportedly set for first week of April, though White House says not finalized
Japan's Nikkei 225 hits fresh record near 58,000 on Takaichi landslide and stimulus expectations

USD.summary: Dollar sold off sharply on Monday as DXY fell to 96.88-97.76 range. Pressure stemmed from broad JPY strength post-Japanese election and Bloomberg report that China is urging banks to curb UST exposure, reviving 'sell America' concerns. Fed's Miran noted no significant tariff-driven inflation seen so far and rates should be much lower. Key NFP (Wed) and CPI (Fri) data ahead will shape Fed rate expectations.
headlines: Bloomberg: China urging banks to curb US Treasury exposure amid market risk
Fed's Miran: No significant tariff-driven inflation, rates should be much lower

EUR.summary: Euro firmed alongside broader G10 strength against the USD, gaining around 0.8% with EUR/USD printing 1.1803-1.1918 range. Supported by softer dollar backdrop and constructive flows into both high-beta and low-beta FX. ECB's Lagarde expects inflation to stabilize sustainably at 2% target and reiterated data-dependent, meeting-by-meeting approach. Little fresh Eurozone-specific news shaping price action.
headlines: ECB President Lagarde: Expects inflation to stabilize sustainably at 2% target
EUR/USD gains 0.8% to 1.1918 high on dollar weakness

GBP.summary: Sterling gained but lagged G10 peers despite weaker USD, weighed by deepening UK political instability. PM Starmer faced renewed pressure after Chief of Staff McSweeney resigned over Mandelson scandal, with reports suggesting Cabinet resignations possible unless PM steps down. However, PM Starmer reaffirmed he will stay in position and key Cabinet ministers (Reeves, Rayner, Streeting) backed him. Cable choppy in 1.3586-1.3700 range.
headlines: UK PM Starmer vows to stay on, not prepared to walk away from power
UK Chancellor Reeves and Deputy PM Rayner back PM Starmer

JPY.summary: Yen outperformed sharply after PM Takaichi's landslide LDP victory. USD/JPY initially gapped higher to 157.72 before reversing sharply to 155.52 low. Drivers included expectations of LDP supermajority, higher JGB yields, Finance Minister Katayama jawboning, rising April BoJ hike odds (~60%), and PM Takaichi's commitment to fiscal discipline. Barclays brought forward expected 25bps BoJ hike to April and lifted terminal rate forecast to 1.5%.
headlines: PM Takaichi wins landslide with LDP securing supermajority
Barclays brings forward BoJ hike to April, lifts terminal rate to 1.5%

AUD.summary: Aussie buoyed by risk sentiment and gains in precious metals. APAC stocks mostly higher as region took impetus from Wall Street gains. ASX 200 marginally gained with tech outperformance, though limited by weakness in top-weighted financials. Gold reclaimed USD 5,000/oz level on dollar weakness. Westpac Consumer Sentiment fell -2.6% (Feb) vs -1.7% prior, but broader risk-on tone supported AUD.
headlines: ASX 200 gains with tech sector outperformance

CAD.summary: Loonie gained modestly alongside G10 peers vs weakening dollar. Crude oil prices rose with WTI settling USD 0.81 higher at 64.36/bbl and Brent USD 0.99 higher at 69.04/bbl, driven by broader risk sentiment and dollar weakness. Additional support from Qatar pushing LNG expansion to end of 2026. Trump posted about Canada tariffs and bridge ownership, adding uncertainty. House Democrats may force vote on Canada tariffs Wednesday.
headlines: WTI settles +$0.81 at $64.36/bbl on risk-on sentiment and dollar weakness
US House Democrats may force vote on Canada tariffs Wednesday

CHF.summary: Franc outperformed alongside AUD as one of the strongest G10 currencies vs the dollar. CHF benefitted from both safe-haven flows (China UST exposure concerns, 'sell America' theme) and broad dollar weakness. Swiss sight deposits fell (Domestic CHF 430.6bln from 436.6bln, Total CHF 447.4bln from 452.7bln). No fresh SNB commentary, but CHF supported by multiple drivers.
headlines: Swiss sight deposits decline in latest week
CHF outperforms as safe-haven and dollar weakness converge

NZD.summary: Kiwi strengthened in line with broader G10 gains against the dollar, with AUD benefiting most from improved risk tone and general USD sell-off. NZD supported by risk-on sentiment as APAC stocks rallied. Hang Seng and Shanghai Comp lagged regional peers in mixed trade, with Hong Kong led by pharmaceuticals while mainland flat amid little fresh drivers. No fresh NZ data, but high-beta characteristics supported gains.
headlines: APAC stocks mostly higher on Wall Street tech rally
